lead_paragraph: A lawsuit is challenging the way decisions are made — including selling rights to a high-rise next door — at the nonprofit art school in Manhattan.

byline.original: By TOM MASHBERG and COLIN MOYNIHAN

headline.print_headline: Air Rights and Airing Grievances at Venerable Art Students League
headline.main: At Art Students League, Air Rights and Airing Grievances

snippet: A lawsuit is challenging the way decisions are made — including selling rights to a high-rise next door — at the nonprofit art school in Manhattan.
abstract: Non-profit Manhattan school Art Students League contends with internal lawsuit from 300 of its board members regarding 2014 sale of air rights above its landmark 1892 French Renaissance-style headquarters for $31.8 million; issue is one of several gripes faction of voting members have with president Salvatore Barbieri; group is also seeking to stop proposed changes to institution's constitution, which they believe could help leadership expand power.
